meanings.definition: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
meanings.sent1: She gave an eloquent speech at the event, captivating the audience with her words.
meanings.sent2: The author's eloquent writing style made the novel a joy to read.
meanings.sent3: His eloquent explanation of why he couldn't do his homework left his teacher speechless.
meanings.sent4: The painting was so eloquent, it seemed to speak to the viewer without words.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song was as eloquent as a heartfelt apology.

meanings.definition: Marked by forceful and fluent expression.
meanings.sent1: The actor's eloquent performance moved the audience to tears.
meanings.sent2: Her eloquent gestures emphasized the importance of her message.
meanings.sent3: The chef's eloquent use of spices in the dish created a burst of flavor in every bite.
meanings.sent4: The storm's eloquent display of power left the town in awe of nature's force.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's eloquent movements on the field showed a deep understanding of the game.
